page.title: 01OWLS IN BLUE-BELL WOOD
page.content:
{Bluebell wood}is in the{Piethorn {valley}in the{Pennines. Bluebell wood is a nature reserve and you are not allowed to take any plants or animals without permission from the{Piethorne {Warden.}In{Bluebell wood}we found some {owl pellets}which show that{owls}live in the wood or near by. If you look inside a{pellet}you will find{ {bones,grass}and{leaves.}The owl has no teeth and usually eats its prey whole all that is left comes in a pellet out of the owls mouth after its eal. But we did not see any owls because we went during the day but there is other evidence that{squirrels,mice}and{voles live there. We saw a squirrel and a mouse and found vole bones in the owl pellet.
A/B/29/5/85
